Dead By Daylight is a super fun game to play with friends, i personally don't really enjoy it unless i'm playing a custom match with friends over call or just doing survivor matches with my mates but playing as a killer can be enjoyable too. I definitely recommend Dead By Daylight if you're looking for a game to play with friends, or just for a multiplayer horror cat/mouse kind of game.

Most dlc survivors are decent, but I'll always keep going back to Claudette and Nea, Dead By Daylight is one of those games where you don't need dlc to have fun, it only enhances the experience. The same goes for killers, although i don't play killer much, i enjoy the nurse's mechanics, along with the huntress', and those two are free. Overall, a good game.

Honorable mention is that they're currently updating graphics.

It is true how sometimes a killer can shutdown survivors out of the blue and lack proper knowledge or judgement which might make the game infuriating, but the point of loosing or making mistakes is part of a game. Some that people fail to grasp and are quick to blame others or the game itself. Now I ain't saying the game is perfect (cause it has plenty of bugs), but really what game doesn't have bugs. You can argue that the developers are slow or don't understand and I will not argue with that since this game receives updates frequently. Sometimes if issues are left alone, its probably for a reason such as having to revamp the entire game or switching to a different engine to fix said issues. To sum up this rant, if you like the game, learn to deal with it, if not, why bother ripping on it or playing it?

Uno de los mejores juegos de la historia, me salvo del ebola y ahora soy licenciado.

I like this game alot, even though I feel as though it favors the killers a little too heavily but with friends this game can be very fun and jump-scary. Perfect for playing alone in the dark and you need a little edge to your night. Graphics are amazing and it feels very smooth to operate, and easier than most games to learn right away. I'm still learning myself but I feel comfortable after just a few games to know what to do. Have fun!

Very fun game to play with friends and kill your friends more importantly. Really enjoyable to try out new builds and synergies but survivors and killers alike will end your career via endgame chat if you do something that isn't in their list of do's and dont's.
Allows me to act on my bloodlust

TL;DR had money to shell for base game and by extension its DLC over time, much more enjoyable if you have money to spare for DLC so you get useful perks. They make the game better because you can survive longer if you use them right. As much fun as I have on here, it's not a game I would recommend. If you don't like the repetition of surviving and dying, dying, dying, dying, hook, unhook, surviving(and the Killer's version of it), you won't like this game in the slightest. Especially if you have no patience.


Apparently I've played 130 hours of this game! Wouldn't recommend it for the life of me though, unless you already have at least one person to survive with who will make the game fun for you. Or help you win, if you're in it solely for the experience of winning. Mostly I recommend SWF(survive with friends) so you can have a good laugh and a scream over voice chat. Mixed bag really, sometimes it's frustrating in public lobbies and sometimes it ranges from neutral to feeling accomplished.

DBD gets frustrating for a lot of people, so if you want to try this game, don't go into it expecting anything. Toxicity in post-game chats is extremely common among the community, never had it happen to me specifically but it's still something you should be prepared for. Personally I feel it's more so on the shoulders of the community, but the game itself still shoulders some blame. BHVR too. I wouldn't know though, I don't care about that crap. I just log on and play either Surv or Killer and then go to sleep.

Matchmaking has long been a big issue for me, being rank 17-15 consistently and being put up against people <10 rank-wise, quite frustrating sometimes. Recently they've changed the matchmaking(as of 13 June 2021), and I don't know if this has to do with recent wraith nerfs but I've rarely had any DLC killers since the new SBMM or whatever it's called. Just a bunch of wraiths and the usual camping huntress - though there's definitely non-campy huntresses out there, I just never have the privilege of going against them. Essentially the "new" SBMM has effectively managed to make the game quite boring for me, but maybe it's because I'll slowly level up playing with the people around my rank and then the true suffering will begin when I'm in the higher ranks if I ever bother to play that long. Who knows. Maybe your experience will be different.

If you want the good perks and to have a better chance of surviving(and therefore enjoying) the game, you'll have to prepare to open your wallet because to my knowledge all the super useful perks come with DLC, not the base game. And anyway if you have money to shell for DBD, you'll probably have money to pay for/waste for new survivors, depending on how you look at spending for DLC. On the bright side, at least you get fun perks to experiment with and new orgasm noises added whenever your survivor of choice gets hit! Some of them sound downright [i]sinful[/i] and it is strange in its own right. 

Sound design outside of voice-acting(moaning? shrieking? groaning? whimpering?) is pretty good at helping the atmosphere, I've been spooked by environmental noises that pop out of pure silence or a rando jumpscaring me before the killer even has a chance to.

Do I enjoy the game? Depends on the match, ultimately it's the people that either make or break it for me for the day/match. If you don't want to take the risk, maybe don't bother until the base game and its DLCs get prices slashed during sales.

Or get the game specifically because you're a shameless simp for at least one of the killers and survivors, I know that was my reason.

The entity has watched me make survivors squeal and suffer in my wake, as I Mori stab them multiple time while they are on the ground and hear their cries of agony and despair, begging to be rescued by their friends.. I like to play with my food, so I take a selfie with them while they are helpless on the ground, unable to stand, bleeding from their mouths.. the entity thinks I am going insane, and it may be right - because Ghost Face is a stalking killing machine that lurks from the shadows around every corner, prowling on gen rushers and killing survivors who seriously never knew what hit them - [b]When you least expect it.. I'll be there.. Waiting..[/b]

[b]This is one of the greatest experiences I've had in a multiplayer horror game ever.[/b]

It's fun. It's seriously so. insanely. fun. Ghost Face is my all-time favourite killer in the game because I love stealth playstyle in every game I play - I really enjoy the ability to prowl and crouch, remaining hidden from view as I stalk my enemies and one hit them before they even see it coming.

I really enjoy a playstyle that revolves around being stealthy and Ghost Face has done that for me in this game. Seriously. I don't think I'd enjoy the game as much if it were not for Ghost Face's existance because he offers such a unique fun way to play the game and to remain stealthy against people who have 3rd person view is not always easy, so you have to always think of their perspective aswell and move around smart to not be seen - and since Ghost Face has no heart beat as he gets closer to enemies when his power is ON.. you're going to look really creepy peeking around a corner, staring at someone doing a generator - its even more fun when they notice you in the last second and try to run for their lives but by then, I am already too close.. and its too late. 

[b]MASTERPIECE, 10/10, would recommend to every single player because there is a place for everyone here.[/b]

Edit: Indoors maps are extremely garbage like half the killers can't use their powers so you're either stuck playing actual trash for upwards of 15 mins or quitting which gives you a penalty for not liking their extreme garbage

Edit2: The developers added MMR forcing the game to be competitive
